result.execSummary:
The defendant Aleece L Gillespie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Jail (Straight Time).
Consecutive to: Any Other Sentences.

Probation may be transferred to Kenosha County.
Concurrent with: Present Probation Sentences.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Defendant may perform 25 hours of Community Service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the costs.  Court costs to be paid after all restitution has been paid on the other cases.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

No contact with Antonio W., Deandre M., Chekevia J. or Target Stores.
Take Criminal Thinking and Cognitive Thinking Courses.
Defendant not to possess or consume any drugs.
Defendant not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.
Obtain a valid driver's license during the First 9 months of Probation.
Defendant to continue to pay Restitution as ordered on the other cases.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  30 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED to be used at the Agent's discretion.  Huber/Jail (Straight time) to be used at the Agent's discretion.

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Aleece L Gillespie in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed - reading waived.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  9 months jail straight time consecutive to any other sentences  STAYED for 12 months Probation concurrent to present probation sentences - Probation may be transferred to Kenosha County
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - Defendant may perform 25 hours of community service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the costs. Court costs to be paid after all 
restitution has been paid on the other cases.  
- Restitution - defendant to continue to pay restitution as ordered on ther other cases
- Conditions of  Probation:  Maintain full-time employment. No contact with Antonio W., Deandre M., Chekevia J. or Target stores. Criminal thinking and Cognitive thinking. No drugs. No illegal drugs. Obtain a valid DL during the 1st 9 months of Probation.   
 -  30 days jail Condition Time with huber (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 19, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Defendant Aleece L Gillespie in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 11:00 am.
